titles.title: Nägäśt dagǝmawi “The Second (Book) of Kings” / Nägäśt śalǝsawi “The Third (Book) of Kings” / Nägäśt rabǝʿawi “The Fourth (Book) of Kings”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Nägäśt dagǝmawi “The Second (Book) of Kings” [Samuel 2] (fols. 1ra-10vb), incomplete (starting from 17:17, the beginning is missing) II) Nägäśt śalǝsawi “The Third (Book) of Kings” [Kings 1] (fols. 11ra-51rb, 55r-56v, 65rv) III) Nägäśt rabǝʿawi “The Fourth (Book) of Kings” [Kings 2] (fols. 51va-54vb, 57ra-64v, 66r-79rb, 83va-86rb), incomplete, fols. are misplaced, the end is missing.

txstates.txstate: The boards are missing. The sewing is damaged. Many leaves are severely damaged by rodents with the loss of text, especially at the beginning (fols. 1-47). Many leaves are severely stained with water, especially at the end of the Ms. (fols. 63-88), are cockled and stuck to each other. Many leaves are misplaced, many are missing, Text I and possibly III are incomplete. Text on some fols. is barely legible due to faded ink: e.g., fols. 59r, 60r, 67v, 71v. Cuts on fols. 16, 25, 34. The spine and edges could not be photographed because of the poor condition of the Ms.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

txfolios.txfolio: Fols. 80-83, 87-88 could not be photographed due to poor condition of the Ms.

squires.squire: The structure of the quires is not discernible due to poor condition of the Ms.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1J-1J-1J1J/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1J-1J-1J1J/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The ruling pattern cannot be assessed with certainty due to present condition of the Ms.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Some ancient/distinctive features: - መ has the loops not completely separated, of triangular shape (e.g., fol. 44vb ls. 3 and 13). - the 6th order marker of ው is attached to the upper horizontal stroke of the letter (e.g., fols. 49ra ls. 1 and 18, 74vb l. 7). - the 6th order marker of ሕ, ቅ and ት is curved at the top of the letter and cannot be easily distinguished from the 1st order of the same letters (e.g., fols. 31va l. 20, 32rb l. 17, 34vb l. 18, 44va l. 13). - the 6th order marker of እ has a long horizontal stroke toward the left (e.g. fols. 31vb l. 10, 68ra l. 14). - ዓ has the 5th order marker attached to the centre of the body (e.g. fols. 49vrb l. 25, 68rb l. 18). - ዱ has two horizontal strokes on the right side (e.g., fol. 44va l. 6). - the 7th order marker of ሮ and ኖ is attached directly to the downstroke (e.g., fols. 30vb ls. 13 and 14, 31ra l. 25, 34vb l. 2). - numerals are written without dashes (e.g., fols. 10vb, 51rb, 51v). - the qom-sign is inserted in the left margin of the column (e.g., fols. 26va, 48va) or embedded within the text (e.g., fols. 44vb, 47rb, 64vb) - the zǝyä-sign is inserted in the left margin of the column (fol. 54rb) or embedded within the text (e.g., fols. 44vb, 64vb) - sentence dividers are accompanied by paragraphs signs.

pcruxansatas.pcruxansata: the crux ansata and the coronis (together or not) are used in the margin of the text, marking the caesura (e.g. fols. 1ra, 52vb)

rubrications.rubrication: Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III, alternating with black lines; concluding formula of Texts I and II; chapter titles; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers, crux ansata, coronis, qom-sign, zǝyä-sign.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The correct order of the fols. of Text III is: 51, 52, 61, 69-70, 72-78, 58, 53, [a portion is missing] 62, 68, 59, 83-86, [a portion is missing] 67, 60, 71, [a portion is missing], 66, 57, 54, the end is missing. - The Ms. is written in the same ancient hand j as the text on fol. 153rv in UM-050 (Kings 2 18:32-19:15). The leaf should be placed before fol. 66.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters, words, or passages inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 20va, 26ra, 29va, 34ra, 36vb, 40vb, 52vb, 65ra. - Omitted letters added at the beginning of the line: fols. 18va, 35rb. - Omitted letters added at the end of the line: fol. 18va. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 17rb, 25ra, 32ra, 43va, 56rb, 75ra. - Corrections written over erasures in the main hand: fols. 30vb, 35rb, 38ra, 40vb, 73ra. - Immediate corrections indicated by a frame around the letters: fol. 42ra. - The scribe used compressed script: fols. 10vb, 39va, 54ra, 58ra. - Rubricated chapter titles in the upper margin of many leaves: e.g., fols. 22vb, 31ra, 49vb, 52ra, 54ra.
